comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; Intel Mac OS X 10_6_4; en-US) AppleWebKit/534.16 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/10.0.648.133 Safari/534.16
Build Identifier: 

Sorani Kurdish is spoken and written in parts of Iraq and Iran, and apparently is distinct enough from Kurmaji that it should be added as a separate option.

It is usually written in Arabic/Persian script, but sometimes text is written in Latin letters.

Note: these three Bugzilla entries request localization into CKB, but I didn't actually see the request for adding the code to the options (is this implicit?)
583089
580798
593047

Reproducible: Always

Actual Results:  
No support for CKB

comments.creator: cwcornelius@gmail.com
comments.author: cwcornelius@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
Localizing a product to a language requires a lot more work than just adding a language to the Accept-Language selection menu. The latter (this bug) is basically one-line change.  So, this bug can be resolved without localizing Firefox to Sorani. 

bug 583089
bug 580798
bug 593047
